level.heading:
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS (§ 17-7902) Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, an applicant for a license shallurnish proof satisfactory to the Board, in accordance with § 841 of the Act,.C. Official Code § 3-1208.41, of the following: That the applicant has graduated with a Master’s degree or a Doctoral Degree in speech-language pathology from a recognized educational institutionhose speech language pathology program is accredited by the Council on Academicccreditation in Audiology and Speech Language Pathology, an accrediting bodyecognized by the United States Department of Education, or an equivalentccrediting body as determined by the Board.
(b) That the applicant met the requirements set forth in section 7905 of theseegulations; and
(c) That the applicant has completed a period of clinical fellowship asequired by these regulations.
